taxonConcepts.nameAccordingTo: Species 2000 & ITIS Catalogue of Life: April 2013

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#GeneralDescription
dataObjects.title: Biology
dataObjects.description: Occurs in swamps, pools, brooks and small streams in the coastal rainforest and forested savanna (Ref. 3788).  Bottom spawner, 2 months incubation.  Is easy to maintain in the aquarium (Ref. 27139).

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Distribution
dataObjects.description: Africa:  Bandama, Comoé and Bia river drainages in central, southern and eastern Côte d'Ivoire.  The Bia, Tano, Ankobra and Oda river drainages in southwestern Ghana.

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Habitat
dataObjects.title: Environment
dataObjects.description: benthopelagic; non-migratory; freshwater; pH range: 6.0 - 7.0; dH range: 5 - 12

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Diseases
dataObjects.description: Costia Disease. Parasitic infestations (protozoa, worms, etc.)

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Conservation
dataObjects.title: IUCN Red List Assessment
dataObjects.rights: © International Union for Conservation of Nature and Natural Resources
dataObjects.rightsHolder: International Union for Conservation of Nature and Natural Resources
dataObjects.bibliographicCitation: Entsua-Mensah, M. & Lalèyè, P. 2010. Fundulopanchax walkeri. In: IUCN 2014 . IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Version 2014.1 . <www.iucnredlist.org>
dataObjects.description:
Red List Category
NT
Near Threatened

Red List Criteria

Version
3.1

Year Assessed
2010

Assessor/s
Entsua-Mensah, M. & Lalèyè, P.

Reviewer/s
Snoeks, J., Darwall, W. & Smith, K.

Contributor/s

Justification
This species has been recorded from eastern Côte d'Ivoire and southwestern Ghana where it is impacted by mining and deforestation. Its extent of occurrence is estimated to be about 150,000 km², but its area of occupancy could be close to meeting 2,000 km² threshold for the Vulnerable category. Currently it has been recorded from more than 10 locations. The species is assessed as Near Threatened (close to meeting B2), and it needs to be monitored as the population is declining.
